caller_intent: Shea Glass, president of Greystone Condos, is seeking clarification about an unauthorized $15.47 credit card charge by Auto Owners, which he believes was mistakenly processed despite his policies being set to auto-pay. He also mentions a pending check that was supposed to resolve the payment issue.
resolution_steps: Gloria acknowledges the charge and explains that Shea made the payment himself via the Auto Owners portal.
Shea admits he forgot about a prior agreement to send a check and mistakenly initiated the online payment.
Gloria offers to contact Auto Owners to request a refund for the $15.47 charge.
Shea confirms the check has not yet been received and agrees to follow up with his treasurer.
knowledge_required: Understanding Auto Owners' payment systems and refund processes
Knowledge of HO6 and condo insurance policy management
Ability to reconcile client payment methods (auto-pay vs. manual checks)
summary: Shea Glass contacted Gloria Galassi about an unexpected $15.47 credit card charge by Auto Owners, which he mistakenly processed online despite having auto-pay set up. Gloria clarified the error, acknowledged the confusion, and committed to contacting Auto Owners for a refund. The call concluded with Shea agreeing to follow up with his treasurer about the pending check.
